group ab.gloss: the blood group whose red cells carry both the A and B antigens

group amentiferae.gloss: used in some classification systems for plants that bear catkins

group b.gloss: the blood group whose red cells carry the B antigen

group discussion.gloss: a discussion among participants who have an agreed (serious) topic

group o.gloss: the blood group whose red cells carry neither the A nor B antigens

group psychotherapy.gloss: psychotherapy in which a small group of individuals meet with a therapist

group pteridospermae.gloss: used in some classification systems: a group of extinct fossil gymnosperms coextensive with the order Cycadofilicales

group pteridospermaphyta.gloss: used in some classification systems: a group of extinct fossil gymnosperms coextensive with the order Cycadofilicales

group therapy.gloss: psychotherapy in which a small group of individuals meet with a therapist

grouping.gloss: any number of entities (members) considered as a unit
a system for classifying things into groups

grouse-berry.gloss: shrub of northwestern North America bearing red berries

grouse whortleberry.gloss: shrub of northwestern North America bearing red berries

grouseberry.gloss: shrub of northwestern North America bearing red berries

grove.gloss: garden consisting of a small cultivated wood without undergrowth

groveler.gloss: someone who humbles himself as a sign of respect

groveller.gloss: someone who humbles himself as a sign of respect

grover cleveland.gloss: 22nd and 24th President of the United States (1837-1908)

groves.gloss: United States general who served as military director of the atomic bomb project (1896-1970)

grower.gloss: someone concerned with the science or art or business of cultivating the soil

growing.gloss: (biology) the process of an individual organism growing organically

growl.gloss: to utter or emit low dull rumbling sounds

growling.gloss: the sound of growling (as made by animals)

growth.gloss: (biology) the process of an individual organism growing organically
a process of becoming larger or longer or more numerous or more important
the gradual beginning or coming forth

growth-onset diabetes.gloss: severe diabetes mellitus with an early onset

growth hormone.gloss: a hormone produced by the anterior pituitary gland

growth hormone-releasing factor.gloss: a releasing factor that accelerates the secretion of growth hormone by the anterior pituitary body

growth rate.gloss: the rate of increase in size per unit time

growth regulator.gloss: (botany) a plant product that acts like a hormone

growth ring.gloss: an annual formation of wood in plants as they grow

groyne.gloss: a protective structure of stone or concrete

grozny.gloss: the capital of Chechnya in southwestern Russia

groznyy.gloss: the capital of Chechnya in southwestern Russia

grubby.gloss: thickly covered with ingrained dirt or soot

grugru.gloss: tropical American feather palm having a swollen spiny trunk and edible nuts

grugru palm.gloss: tropical American feather palm having a swollen spiny trunk and edible nuts

gruiformes.gloss: inland marsh-dwelling birds with long legs and necks and bills that wade in water in search of food: cranes

grumble.gloss: show one's unhappiness or critical attitude
make complaining remarks or noises under one's breath
to utter or emit low dull rumbling sounds

grumbler.gloss: a person given to excessive complaints and crying and whining

grumbling.gloss: continuous full and low-pitched throbbing sound

grume.gloss: a semisolid mass of coagulated red and white blood cells

grummet.gloss: fastener consisting of a metal ring for lining a small hole to permit the attachment of cords or lines

grunge.gloss: the state of being covered with unclean things

grunt.gloss: the short low gruff noise of the kind made by hogs

grus.gloss: a small constellation in the southern hemisphere near Phoenix
type genus of the Gruidae: typical cranes

grus americana.gloss: rare North American crane having black-and-white plumage and a trumpeting call

gryphon.gloss: winged monster with the head of an eagle and the body of a lion

grease one's palms.gloss: make illegal payments to in exchange for favors or influence

grind away.gloss: study intensively, as before an exam

grind down.gloss: rule a country as a tyrant

grind out.gloss: produce in a routine or monotonous manner

grow.gloss: pass into a condition gradually, take on a specific property or attribute
cultivate by growing, often involving improvements by means of agricultural techniques
come to have or undergo a change of (physical features and attributes)

gruntle.gloss: cause to be more favorably inclined

grabby.gloss: immoderately desirous of acquiring e.g. wealth

gracious.gloss: characterized by kindness and warm courtesy especially of a king to his subjects

graded.gloss: arranged in a sequence of grades or ranks

graduated.gloss: marked with or divided into degrees

graeco-roman.gloss: of or pertaining to or characteristic of the ancient Greeks and Romans, especially their art, literature, or culture

graecophilic.gloss: characterized by a love of Greece and Grecian things

grainy.gloss: composed of or covered with particles resembling meal in texture or consistency

grammatical.gloss: conforming to the rules of grammar or usage accepted by native speakers

granitic.gloss: showing unfeeling resistance to tender feelings

granular.gloss: composed of or covered with particles resembling meal in texture or consistency
having a granular structure like that of chondrites

granulose.gloss: composed of or covered with particles resembling meal in texture or consistency

grapey.gloss: having a taste like that of grapes

graphical.gloss: relating to or presented by a graph

grapy.gloss: having a taste like that of grapes

graspable.gloss: capable of being apprehended or understood

gratifying.gloss: pleasing to the mind or feeling

gratulatory.gloss: expressive of sympathetic pleasure or joy on account of someone's success or good fortune

gravelly.gloss: unpleasantly harsh or grating in sound

graven.gloss: cut or impressed into a surface

gravid.gloss: in an advanced stage of pregnancy

gravitational.gloss: of or relating to or caused by gravitation

gravitative.gloss: of or relating to or caused by gravitation

gray-haired.gloss: showing characteristics of age, especially having grey or white hair

gray-headed.gloss: showing characteristics of age, especially having grey or white hair

grayish.gloss: of an achromatic color of any lightness intermediate between the extremes of white and black

greased.gloss: smeared with oil or grease to reduce friction

greasy.gloss: containing an unusual amount of grease or oil

great.gloss: in an advanced stage of pregnancy

grecian.gloss: of or relating to or characteristic of Greece or the Greeks or the Greek language

greco-roman.gloss: of or pertaining to or characteristic of the ancient Greeks and Romans, especially their art, literature, or culture

greedy.gloss: immoderately desirous of acquiring e.g. wealth
(often followed by `for') ardently or excessively desirous

greek orthodox.gloss: of or relating to or characteristic of the Eastern Orthodox Church

green-blind.gloss: inability to see the color green or to distinguish green and purplish-red

green-eyed.gloss: suspicious or unduly suspicious or fearful of being displaced by a rival

green-white.gloss: of white flowers tinged with green

greenish.gloss: of the color between blue and yellow in the color spectrum

greenish-white.gloss: of white flowers tinged with green

greensick.gloss: of or pertaining to or suffering from chlorosis

grey-haired.gloss: showing characteristics of age, especially having grey or white hair

grey-headed.gloss: showing characteristics of age, especially having grey or white hair

greyish.gloss: of an achromatic color of any lightness intermediate between the extremes of white and black

grievous.gloss: causing fear or anxiety by threatening great harm
causing or marked by grief or anguish
of great gravity or crucial import

grilled.gloss: cooked by radiant heat (as over a grill)

grim.gloss: not to be placated or appeased or moved by entreaty
harshly uninviting or formidable in manner or appearance

grimy.gloss: thickly covered with ingrained dirt or soot

gripping.gloss: capable of arousing and holding the attention

gritty.gloss: composed of or covered with particles resembling meal in texture or consistency

groggy.gloss: stunned or confused and slow to react (as from blows or drunkenness or exhaustion)

grooved.gloss: established as if settled into a groove or rut

grotesque.gloss: distorted and unnatural in shape or size

ground-hugging.gloss: of plants that grow relatively low to the ground

groundless.gloss: without a basis in reason or fact

grudging.gloss: petty or reluctant in giving or spending

grueling.gloss: characterized by effort to the point of exhaustion

gruelling.gloss: characterized by effort to the point of exhaustion

gruff.gloss: deep and harsh sounding as if from shouting or illness or emotion

grumose.gloss: transformed from a liquid into a soft semisolid or solid mass

grumous.gloss: transformed from a liquid into a soft semisolid or solid mass

grungy.gloss: thickly covered with ingrained dirt or soot

gracefully.gloss: in a gracious or graceful manner

graciously.gloss: in a gracious or graceful manner

gratingly.gloss: in a harsh and grating manner

gravely.gloss: in a grave and sober manner
to a severe or serious degree
